snippet: Seven animals were accepted at Connecticut’s Beardsley Zoo on Saturday for the state’s second Exotic Animal Amnesty Day.
abstract: Beardsley Zoo in Bridgeport, Conn, holds second Exotic Animal Amnesty Day, event that allows owners of illegal exotic pets to anonymously surrender animals to zoo in compliance with changes to Connecticut laws stemming from 2009 incident when pet chimpanzee attacked a woman in Stamford.
lead_paragraph: Seven animals were accepted at Connecticut’s Beardsley Zoo on Saturday for the state’s second Exotic Animal Amnesty Day.

headline.seo: On Amnesty Day, Owners Hand Over Exotic Pets
headline.main: On Amnesty Day, Somber Owners Surrender Pythons and a Snapping Turtle
headline.print_headline: On Amnesty Day, Somber Owners Surrender Pythons and a Snapping Turtle
